intro: Eriotheca vargasii, commonly known as the Vargas's eriotheca, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
